title: Introducing: The Delphines
body: What is it with my sudden infatuation with riot-grrrl inspired pop-punk bands? First [**PINS**](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/17454-video-pins-you-dont-need-to-be-live/), then [**Maggie Moon**](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/16791-introducing-maggie-moon/), followed by last week’s debut track from [**Silkies**](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/17676-new-silkies-like-one/), and now Milwaukee duo **The Delphines**. With a scuzzy 60’s sound and lyrics just calling out to be bellowed back to them from the confines of a sweaty, writhing mosh-pit of scene kids (“_she’s gotta toytonic boy, her shoes are falling apart, he’s got a name that you can’t pronounce_“), **The Delphines** have attitude in abundance. Check out their two debut tracks below – _Toytonic_ and _Under Tablecloths_.
